On Dec 16, 2011, at 9:11 PM, Moore, Jonathan (CIM) wrote:

> On 12/16/11 2=

> 
>> 
>> On =
Dec 16, 2011, at 7:51 PM, Moore, Jonathan (CIM) wrote:
>> 
>>> I
>>> would =
argue that this definition includes an *idempotent* partial
>>> update.
>> =

>> Could you point to the part of the spec that leads you to this assumpti=
on?
>> 
>> Jan
>> 
> 
> Not exactly, because the spec does not specifically=
 rule it out.

The first sentence in 9.6. which you for whatever reason did=
 not quote:

"The PUT method requests that the enclosed entity be stored un=
der the supplied Request-URI"

These days, it is always helpful to check th=
e forthcoming version of the spec:

http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-h=
ttpbis-p2-semantics-17#section-6.6 (see last two paragraphs of 6.6)


Jan

=


> I could
> ask the inverse question: where does the spec require that th=
e update be
> non-partial?
> 
> 9.6. PUT
> ...If the Request-URI refers to =
an already existing resource, the enclosed
> entity SHOULD be considered as=
 a modified version of the one residing on
> the origin server.
> 
> Why is=
 "whatever is already there, with the following (idempotent)
> modification=
" not an acceptable description of a modified version?
> 
> Jon
